Title: Man on horseback
Biographical Information: Henry Watkins Allen (1820-1866) established the Allendale sugar plantation in West Baton Rouge Parish, Louisiana, in the early 1850s. Allendale Plantation changed hands several times over the years, until 1882, when John and Martin James Kahao purchased the land, buildings, and equipment. The Kahao family successfully operated the plantation for most of the twentieth century, during which time it underwent a change in farming techniques, moving from hand labor and mule cultivation to mechanized farming.

Title: Costumed revelers on "Realization Day" standing in front of Leonard Krower Jewelers, 625 Canal Street
Subject - Geographic: New Orleans (La.)--Photographs; Canal Street (New Orleans, La.)--Photographs
Abstract (Description): â€œRealization Dayâ€ was a citywide fundraiser to finance reconstruction of Tulane Stadium. On March 31, 1916 Tulane University asked students, faculty, alumni and businesses to donate a dayâ€™s wages to aid reconstruction. The University holiday permitted students to work a full day and local businesses assisted by providing day jobs for students. Total donations amounted to $35,000.
